channel.title: Source Run.Bat Error?
channel.description:
[code]Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Could not create the Java virtual machine. Press any key to continue . . .[/code] I Get This Error When I Run "Run.bat" in the source files... PLEASE HELP ME!
317, delta

item.title: Source Run.Bat Error?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Show us your run.bat

Read full topic

item.title: Source Run.Bat Error?
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:1, topic:366622”]Lol you guys are dipshits

He isnt leaving enough of the JVM for the server to launch, therefore the JVM will fail when he tries to launch

You dont have a virus, you have enough HDD Space

Just replace run.bat with this

@echo off title Perses Pkers is Online! java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Tell me if it works or not[/quote]nope it gave me more errors

Read full topic

item.title: Source Run.Bat Error?
item.dc:creator: @djdoyle1 djdoyle1
item.description:
@djdoyle1 wrote:

You may have a virus. Check your tM for “radx.exe”, if you have it’ll be using 80 - 99% of CPU. Get process blocker and blok Radx.exe

Read full topic

item.title: Source Run.Bat Error?
item.dc:creator: @Cooldude170 Cooldude170
item.description:
@Cooldude170 wrote:

Seems to me like you are running out of hard disk space?
Or Java doesn’t want to take too much memory and you are currently using a lot of RAM, which would cause it to terminate to prevent it from using too much memory and /freezing your computer.
Make sure it’s not one of those.

Read full topic
